message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the sale of this valuable product with you. I believe it's a great opportunity for you to acquire a unique item that will bring you significant value. I'm willing to sell it to you for $20000.
I appreciate your enthusiasm for the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $12000. I believe that's a more reasonable price considering the market value and my budget.

I understand your perspective, Bob, but I have to consider the minimum value I'm willing to accept for the product. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make a profit. I can offer it to you for $18000. This is my final counteroffer, and I'm not willing to go any lower.

I'm afraid $18000 is still above my budget, and I'm not willing to go that high. I'm willing to meet you halfway from my previous offer, so I'll counter with $11000. This is my final offer, and I'm not willing to go any higher.

I understand that you're trying to negotiate, Bob, but I'm not willing to go as low as $11000. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to ensure I'm not losing money on the deal. I can offer it to you for $16000. This is my final counteroffer, and I'm not willing to go any lower.
I'm still not willing to pay $16000. I'm willing to make a serious offer, but I need to stay within my budget. I'll counter with $9500. This is my final offer.
